Text:
Interesting data from 
@PwC_UK
. Lockdown has scuppered Black Friday with just 38% of shoppers interested in making purchases, compared to 51% pre-lockdown.

PwC now predicts Black Friday spend will be down 20% this year. Pre-lockdown predictions - up 8%.Data: Lockdown to scupper Black Friday bonanza – but all is not lost
Lockdown has put the dampeners on a Black Friday sales surge with consumers expected to spend 20% less during the discounting event this year, according to PwC.

Latest UK Economic Update published today by 
@PwC_UK
 suggests UK GDP down by around 8-12% in 2020, but UK exports down by only around 6-8%. If anything, this seems relatively optimistic given the severe downturn in global trade:UK Economic Update
Scenario-based analysis of the potential short-term impacts of COVID-19 on UK economic growth.

This isn’t dumbing down, this is widening access. 

Some of the UKs biggest and best employers like 
@PwC_UK
 don’t require degrees because they want the best people for job, not the best bits of paper.Police dumb down entry standards to meet PM's recruitment pledge
Police forces are dumbing down education standards in a desperate bid to meet Boris Johnson's pledge to recruit 20,000 extra officers, The Mail on Sunday can reveal.

Poland's GDP growth could fall to 0% this year due to #coronavirus, warns Witold Orłowski, chief economic adviser to 
@PwC
 in Poland.

Other analysts have also revised down Poland's growth forecast, though rather less drastically, to around 2-2.5%Koronawirus zredukuje wzrost PKB do zera? Witold Orłowski kreśli czarny scenariusz
Koronawirus spowolni polską gospodarkę. To pewne. Pytanie jak mocno. Według profesora Witolda Orłowskiego nie można wykluczyć, że epidemia nawet zredukuje wzrost PKB do zera.

HIGHLIGHTS: 
-UK growth down to 1.1% in 2019, from 1.4%
-Growth in 2020 at 1.6%
-Both conditional on avoidance of a disorderly Brexit
